pages.text: $(o)There are six basic kinds of alchemical power. $(li)$(4)BLAZE$(0), the power of heat and fire. $(li)$(4)LIGHT$(0), the power of... well, light. $(li)$(4)MIND$(0), the power of enchantments and thought. $(li)$(4)SOUL$(0), the power of the spirit. $(o)$(li)$(4)WARP$(0), the power of space. $(li)$(4)VITAL$(0), the power of life.
$(o)It is worth noting that other kinds of substances can also appear in the Crucible. These are referred to as $(#9d1e2d)Acid$(0), $(#9d1e2d)Body$(0), and $(#9d1e2d)Verdant$(0).

$(o)In solution, Powers might $(thing)react$(0) with each other. Reactions make themselves evident by changing the color of the solution and releasing particles into the air. Sometimes, more violent effects arise as well -- though nothing that damages the surroundings. $(br2)The most common reaction is $(thing)annihilation$(0), wherein Powers destroy each other, releasing smoke or energy in the process.

$(o)It is natural to question which items source which powers. The answer to this is unknown in general, but typically the associations are obvious. A touch of critical thinking and note taking will go a long way here. $(br2)Note that $(4)anything that vanishes when put in the Crucible$(0) does so because a Power was released from it, even if there was no visible change to the Crucible.
